page.title: 19DUNSTALL PARK
page.content: The racecourse originally started at West Park and in 1887 moved to Dunstall Park.The racecourse is 1 mile from the town centre.It covers a 120 acre piece of land and is 1.5 miles around the track.The racing season consists of 6 months flat and 6 months hurdle racing. There are 25 meetings a year.People come from all over the country to visit these races.There are several stands including rooms with televisions on which the races can be watched.There is also the Dunstall Suite which includes a restaurant which is open during and after the races and can be hired for private functions. Inside the track there are several pitches and athletics grounds.They are rented by Wolverhampton Borough Council for schools to use for sporting activities.They can also be hired by clubs for matches and practices.
